They said unlike its plant-eating relatives, Thecodontosaurus may have eaten meat and could have walked on two legs. Experts also reconstructed its inner ears and estimated that it had a high hearing frequency.

column3: After Elon Musk, Oracle Founder Larry Ellison leaves California
column4: Days after Elon Musk criticised California and confirmed that he's moving to Texas, Oracle's billionaire Founder Larry Ellison revealed that he is also leaving the state, for his personal island in Hawaii. "I'll be using...Zoom to work from the island of Lanai," he wrote to his employees. Oracle had confirmed its headquarters will move to Texas from Silicon Valley earlier.

column3: NITI Aayog plans surveillance platform to boost healthcare system
column4: Government think-tank NITI Aayog in its report proposed setting up a surveillance information system to boost India's public health surveillance. The platform will store and analyse information based on individual Electronic Health Records captured through the use of a Unique Health Identifier. "Public health surveillance could be integrated within India's three-tiered health system," it added.

column3: Pinterest settles gender discrimination suit with ex-COO for $22.5 mn
column4: Pinterest has settled the gender discrimination lawsuit filed by its former COO Francoise Brougher for $22.5 million. In August, Brougher had sued Pinterest, alleging gender discrimination, retaliation and wrongful termination. Pinterest and Brougher will donate about $2.5 million of the settlement to organisations that work to advance women and minorities in the technology industry.

column3: Data sciences, tech re-evaluate how industries exist: OYO Founder
column4: OYO Founder and CEO Ritesh Agarwal on Monday said that technology and data sciences need to be given due importance as they "will fundamentally enter and re-evaluate how your industry has existed or will exist in future." He added that young people and educational institutions should give data sciences and engineering due importance.

column3: Apple, Google ban tech that lets apps track users' location: Report
column4: Apple and Google have told developers to remove X-Mode's code from their apps or risk getting them removed from their app stores, The WSJ reported. X-Mode collects users' location data by giving developers code called SDK to put in apps, and sells it. Apple is giving developers two weeks to remove the SDK while Google is giving them a week.

column3: Russian hackers spied on US Treasury's emails: Report
column4: Hackers backed by Russia have been monitoring internal email traffic at the US Treasury and Commerce departments, Reuters reported. The attack's severity led to an NSC meeting at the White House. However, the government hasn't specified who could be behind the attack. Russia described the allegations as another unfounded attempt by the US media to blame it for attacks.

column3: CD Projekt's shares fall over bad Cyberpunk reviews, refund reports
column4: Developer of the Cyberpunk 2077 game CD Projekt's shares fell 13% on Monday after reports of technical glitches in the game led the developer to apologise and offer refunds to dissatisfied customers. Bloomberg reported that the developer has lost 33% market value since the game's debut last week. CD Projekt said it is hoping to fix the "most prominent problems".

column3: Amazon's Zoox unveils autonomous EV that can travel both ways
column4: Amazon-owned self-driving car platform Zoox has unveiled a fully autonomous electric vehicle with no steering wheel which can travel in either direction. Equipped with two battery packs, the four-seater robotaxi can run for 16 hours on a single charge and can attain a maximum speed of 120 kmph. CEO Aicha Evans said Zoox plans on launching an app-based ride-hailing service.

column3: It has been a tough year, I haven't seen home in 6 months now: WI captain Holder
column4: Following their 0-2 Test series defeat against New Zealand, West Indies captain Jason Holder said, "It has been a tough year...I haven’t seen home in six months now." He added, "I've been going non-stop. We've had pay cuts." Talking about "going from bubble to bubble" amid coronavirus pandemic, Holder said, "The room just gets smaller and smaller by the second."

column3: How does the WTC points table read after NZ's 2-0 win over West Indies?
column4: New Zealand defeated West Indies by an innings and 12 runs in second Test to register a 2-0 whitewash in the two-match Test series. With this, they jumped to the third spot on the World Test Championship points table, with 62.5% points earned. West Indies are seventh on the table (11.1% points earned), while India are second (75% points earned).

column3: Not going to reveal our bowling plans to the media for Indians to read about: Lyon
column4: Ahead of the Test series against India, Australia off-spinner Nathan Lyon said he is not going to reveal his team's bowling plans to the media for the Indians to read about. He added, "It is very exciting that we have a few things lined up." He further said, "We are in a better place than we were two years ago."

column3: Australia still the number one Test side, ahead of NZ on decimal points, clarifies ICC
column4: The ICC has clarified that Australia are still the number one Test team, adding that they are ahead of New Zealand on decimal points. This comes after their official website showed both Australia and New Zealand having 116 rating points. The ICC tweeted, "Australia are still no. 1 with 116.461 rating points. New Zealand are just behind with 116.375 points."

column3: Shaw low on confidence, Shubman hasn't played a single Test: Laxman on 2nd opener
column4: Ex-India batsman VVS Laxman has said that there will be a toss-up between Prithvi Shaw and Shubman Gill for the second opener's spot alongside Mayank Agarwal for the upcoming Test against Australia. "Shaw is low on confidence and Shubman hasn't played a single Test," he added. He further suggested that it will be a tough call for Virat Kohli.

column3: Latest rankings for Test batsmen announced, 3 Indians in top 10
column4: The ICC on Tuesday released the latest rankings for Test batsmen. New Zealand captain Kane Williamson dropped one place to be ranked third, while Team India vice-captain Ajinkya Rahane jumped one place to enter into the top 10. Rahane (tenth), Cheteshwar Pujara (seventh) and Virat Kohli (second) are the three Indians in the top 10.

column3: Dhoni backed Kohli when he was on the verge of getting dropped: Manjrekar
column4: Talking about Virat Kohli's performance in Tests in Australia in 2011-12, cricketer-turned-commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said Kohli was "actually" on the verge of getting dropped after Sydney Test. He added, "Dhoni backed him...He played in Perth and scored...70 and then he got the hundred." He further said, "I think that was the only century scored by an Indian in that series."

column3: Mushfiqur Rahim shares pic with teammate he almost hit in anger, apologises
column4: Bangladeshi wicketkeeper Mushfiqur Rahim, who almost hit his teammate Nasum Ahmed in anger during a domestic T20 match, took to Instagram to share a picture with Nasum and issued an apology. Saying that he "already apologised" to Nasum after the match, Rahim wrote, "I would like to apologise to all my fans and spectators regarding the incident."

column3: Good to surprise safest pair of hands: Shaw on video of Saha missing his leg-spin
column4: India batsman Prithvi Shaw took to Instagram to share a video of himself bowling a leg-spin delivery in the practice match against Australia A. The video shows batsman Jack Wildermuth and wicketkeeper Wriddhiman Saha getting beaten by Shaw's spin. "It’s good to surprise...safest pair of hands in the business @wriddhi bhai @ajinkyarahane dada. It'll come your way again," Shaw wrote.

column3: We discuss how to get Virat out not how to taunt him: Aus coach Langer
column4: Australia coach Justin Langer said his team prefers planning on how to dismiss Virat Kohli rather than focusing on how to taunt the Indian captain. "We play on the skill, not on emotions...We have to control our emotions," Langer said. "I have got so much respect for Kohli...we are going to be really well planned for him," Langer added.

column3: I would pick Kuldeep ahead of Ashwin for 1st Test: Shane Warne
column4: Former Australia spinner Shane Warne has said that he would pick Kuldeep Yadav ahead of Ravichandran Ashwin for the first Test. "Ashwin has really struggled in Australia and have not done well here. Kuldeep Yadav has done really well. In case Ravindra Jadeja is out, I will play Kuldeep. I will have three quicks and a spinner," he stated.

column3: Jadeja returns to training ahead of 1st Test, celebrates birthday with Kuldeep, Arun
column4: Ravindra Jadeja has rejoined the squad and was reportedly spotted training on Tuesday ahead of the first Test against Australia. The India cricket team account also posted a video of him cutting a cake along with Kuldeep Yadav and bowling coach Bharat Arun. Jadeja, who suffered a hamstring strain and a concussion in first T20I, turned 32 on December 6.

column3: Fans not allowed for football matches in London again due to COVID-19 spike
column4: Football fans will be missing out on watching matches at stadiums in London as the city moves into Tier 3 of COVID-19 restrictions from Wednesday due to surge in cases. Around two weeks ago, up to 2,000 fans were being allowed into football matches for the first time since March when London was initially placed in Tier 2 restriction.

column3: India had a better side than us in 2018-19 series, we were outplayed: Cummins
column4: Australia pacer Pat Cummins has said that India had a better team in the 2018-19 series but this time the presence of Steve Smith and David Warner will help the hosts in the upcoming Tests. "We've also got a couple of younger guys who've now become really mature...like Travis Head, Marnus Labuschagne...so that's a big help," he further said.

column3: Will definitely miss Ishant, yet to decide team combination: Rahane
column4: India Test vice-captain Ajinkya Rahane on Tuesday said that pacer Ishant Sharma 'will definitely be missed in Australia' but didn't divulge any information about the playing XI combination ahead of the first Test. "There is another day to go, one more practice session to go, we will sit tomorrow (Wednesday) and discuss what's our combination," Rahane said.

column3: KL Rahul might not play the first Test against Australia: Aakash Chopra
column4: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra said that India wicketkeeper-batsman KL Rahul might not play in the first Test against Australia. He said that Rahul has a case to be India's opener in the first game due to his overall Test figures but his last ten innings are going against him. "Rahul [not playing] a warm-up match [also] goes against him," he added.

column3: Who will face who in the Champions League Round of 16?
column4: Defending champions Bayern Munich will face Italian club Lazio in the Champions League Round of 16, while the last year's runner-up PSG will be up against Barcelona. Premier League champions Liverpool will play RB Leipzig while La Liga champions Real Madrid will face Atalanta. Manchester City will take on Borussia Monchengladbach and Serie A champions Juventus will face Porto.

column3: If we can travel and stay in quarantine, why can't umpires: Holder
column4: West Indies Test captain Jason Holder feels that just like cricketers, overseas umpires should also travel and do the quarantine. "I still don't understand a situation where we're just having home umpires. If players are making the sacrifice and going on the road and continuing cricket then I feel as though the umpires should do the same," said Holder.

column3: India will feel the pinch of Kohli's absence in the Test series: Nehra
column4: Ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra has said that Team India "will feel the pinch" of Virat Kohli's absence in the upcoming Test series against Australia. "The way Kohli has scored runs in Australia and [has] been in the face of the opposition will be missed," he added. Nehra further said that India will also miss the experience of pacer Ishant Sharma.

column3: Head says India, heart says Australia: Shane Warne on who'll win Test series
column4: Former Australia spinner Shane Warne has predicted Australia to win the upcoming four-Test series 2-1. "Virat Kohli playing only that first Test match, Australia might have a bit too much firepower. I will say 2-1 to Australia," he stated. The first Test of the series will be a Day-Night match and will be played from December 17 at Adelaide.

column3: Time for Smith to return as captain: Waugh ahead of 1st Test vs India
column4: Ahead of the four-match Test series against India, ex-Australia opener Mark Waugh feels it is time to reinstate Steve Smith as captain. "He's paid his penance there, so he gets back to captain. I think he is a pretty good captain," said Mark Waugh. Smith was removed from captaincy after the 2018 ball-tampering scandal and was banned for a year.

column3: I believe staying in the moment, Virat is our captain now: Rahane on captaining
column4: On being asked about captaining India in the final three Tests against Australia, Test vice-captain Ajinkya Rahane said he'll think about it after the first Test. "I believe staying in the moment...Right now, Virat is our captain. We think about this Test match and then after that when he leaves, we will think [about final three]," he stated.

column3: There're certain things Kohli requires to improve as a Test captain: Laxman
column4: Former India cricketer VVS Laxman has said that there are certain things that India skipper Virat Kohli requires to improve as Test captain. "Kohli becomes a little defensive especially with his field changes... the second thing is chopping and changing the playing XI," he added. Kohli has led India in 55 Tests, winning 33 of them and losing 12.

column3: Pele, Maradona, Messi, Ronaldo part of Ballon d'Or Dream Team
column4: France Football on Monday announced the Ballon d'Or Dream 11 which included Pele, Diego Maradona, Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo. Russia's Lev Yashin was named the goalkeeper. Brazil's Cafu, Germany's Franz Beckenbauer and Italy's Paolo Maldini are manning the defence. Xavi, Germany's Lothar Matthaus, Pele and Maradona complete the midfield. Ronaldo, Messi and Brazil's Ronaldo are up front.

column3: We were trying: Carey on Allan Border's 'disgraceful performance' remark
column4: Former Australia captain Allan Border had criticised Australia A's performance against India in the second practice game, calling it an "absolute disgrace". Responding to the remark, Alex Carey, who captained Australia A, said that their attitude in the match "wasn't bad". "We were trying. It was difficult out there with two set batters," he added.

column3: New variant of coronavirus found, over 1,000 cases identified: UK
column4: The UK's Health Secretary Matt Hancock on Monday said, "Over the last few days, we have identified a new variant of coronavirus which may be associated with the faster spread in the southeast of England." He added, "Initial analysis suggests that this variant is growing faster than the existing variants." The UK has identified over 1,000 cases with this variant.

column3: Critical care nurse becomes 1st American to get Covid-19 vaccine
column4: Sandra Lindsay, a critical care nurse in New York, has become the first American to get vaccinated against coronavirus in a non-trial setting, New York Governor Andrew Cuomo said. "This is what heroes look like...Thank you Sandra and thank you Dr Michelle Chester," Cuomo tweeted. She took the Pfizer-BioNTech coronavirus vaccine on live television.

column3: US Electoral College formally confirms Joe Biden's victory over Trump
column4: The Electoral College has formally confirmed Joe Biden's victory over Donald Trump in the November 3 US Presidential elections. "In this battle for the soul of America, democracy prevailed," Biden said during a speech and called for unity. Biden's speech came after the Electoral College had cast 306 votes for him and 232 for Trump.

column3: UK PM Boris Johnson to be Republic Day Chief Guest
column4: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson has accepted the invitation to be the Chief Guest for next year's Republic Day parade, UK Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab said. Raab, who is on a visit to India, held talks with Foreign Minister S Jaishankar. "I'm pleased that PM Johnson has invited PM Modi to join the UK-hosted G7 summit next year," Raab added.

column3: Sex worker to get six-figure sum in sexual harassment case in NZ
column4: A New Zealand sex worker will receive a six-figure sum after filing a sexual harassment case against a business owner. The human rights body that represented her said the sum is part of a settlement to compensate the woman for "emotional harm and lost earnings". All sex workers have the right to freedom from sexual harassment at work, it added.

column3: Japan's worst bird flu outbreak on record spreads to 10th prefecture
column4: Japan's worst bird flu outbreak on record has spread to new farms and now affects over 20% of the country's 47 prefectures. The government said that around 11,000 birds will be slaughtered and buried after avian influenza was discovered at an egg farm in Higashiomi city in Shiga prefecture. Around 30 lakh birds have been culled in Japan so far.

column3: China forcing Uighurs into hard, manual labour in cotton fields: Report
column4: China is forcing hundreds of thousands of Uighur Muslims and other minorities into hard, manual labour in cotton fields of Xinjiang, according to BBC. More than half a million workers from minority groups are reportedly forced to pick cotton. Reports in the past have claimed that at least one million Uighurs have been kept in detention camps in China.

column3: Japan's 'Twitter killer' sentenced to death for murders of 9 people
column4: A Japanese court on Tuesday sentenced a man dubbed "Twitter killer" to death for the 2017 murders of nine people, eight women and a man, local media reported. Takahiro Shiraishi, 30, was convicted of murdering, raping, dismembering, and storing the nine victims' bodies in his apartment. Shiraishi made contact with victims via Twitter after they expressed suicidal thoughts.

column3: Man rides jetski for 4.5 hrs to see girlfriend, jailed for breaking COVID-19 laws
column4: A 28-year-old Scot was jailed for four weeks for breaching COVID-19 laws after crossing the Irish Sea on a jetski to see his girlfriend. Dale McLaughlan met his girlfriend in September while working as a roofer on the Isle of Man. McLaughlan, who'd never driven a jetski before, believed the journey would take 40 minutes, but it took four-and-a-half hours.

column3: WHO chief should be probed over genocide in Ethiopia: Economist
column4: WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus should be probed over genocide in Ethiopia, Nobel Peace Prize nominee David Steinman said in a complaint to International Criminal Court. He "was a crucial decision-maker in relation to...actions that included killing...and torturing Ethiopians", Steinman said. Ghebreyesus shared control over Ethiopia's security forces between 2013 and 2015, Steinman alleged.

column3: Canada pledges $380mn to help developing countries fight COVID-19
column4: Canada on Monday announced a $380 million aid package to help developing countries fight the coronavirus pandemic. The money will enable UNICEF to buy up to 3 million courses of antibody treatments, once they are approved, it said. The funds will also go to the WHO-led coalition ACT [Access to COVID-19 Tools] Accelerator, and other global health organizations.

column3: Russia's vaccine again found to be 91.4% effective against COVID-19
column4: As per new data published by scientists, Russia's coronavirus vaccine Sputnik V has again been found to be 91.4% effective in providing protection from COVID-19. The new results are based on data from 22,714 participants in the trial. Earlier this month, Dr Reddy's Laboratories began the phase 2/3 clinical trials for the Sputnik V vaccine in India.

column3: Putin congratulates Biden after Electoral College confirms his win
column4: Russian President Vladimir Putin congratulated US President-elect Joe Biden after the Electoral College formally confirmed his win in the Presidential elections. Putin wished Biden success, adding that he was "ready for collaboration and contacts" with Biden. Earlier, Kremlin had said that it would wait for the official results to be announced before congratulating anybody.

column3: Canada administers first doses of Pfizer coronavirus vaccine
column4: Canada began the vaccination drive against coronavirus with Pfizer/BioNTech doses on Monday by injecting frontline workers and elderly nursing home residents. Anita Quidangen, a personal support worker at the Rekai Centre, was the first person to get vaccinated. She took the vaccine on live television. Canada is the third country after the UK and US to administer the Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine.

column3: US court dismisses $100 million lawsuit against PM Modi, Amit Shah
column4: A US court has dismissed a $100 million lawsuit filed against Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Home Minister Amit Shah and Lieutenant General Kanwal Jeet Singh Dhillon. The court dismissed the case after Kashmir Khalistan Referendum Front failed to appear at two hearings. The lawsuit was filed on September 19, 2019 over the abrogation of Article 370 in Jammu and Kashmir.

column3: Trump announces resignation of Attorney General William Barr
column4: US President Donald Trump has announced the resignation of Attorney General William Barr, saying that he would be "leaving just before Christmas". "Our relationship has been a very good one, he has done an outstanding job!" Trump tweeted. There had been tension between the two after Barr said there was no widespread evidence of voter fraud in November's election.

column3: Simply untrue: NY Guv denies ex-aide's sexual harassment accusations
column4: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo on Monday denied former aide Lindsey Boylan's allegations that he "sexually harassed her for years" while she worked in his administration. Cuomo said the accusations were "simply untrue", adding, "I believe a woman has the right to come forward and express her opinion and express issues and concerns that she has."

column3: Kabul's Deputy Governor killed in bomb blast: Police
column4: Kabul's Deputy Governor Mahbubullah Muhibbi and his secretary were killed in a bomb blast in Afghanistan, police said on Tuesday. Muhibbi was travelling with his security guards when the IED that was placed on the vehicle exploded. No group has claimed responsibility for the blast yet. Last week, an Afghan government prosecutor was shot dead in Kabul.

column3: Armenia, Azerbaijan swap prisoners captured during conflict
column4: Armenia and Azerbaijan have begun exchanging prisoners as part of a Russia-brokered peace deal to end conflict over disputed region of Nagorno-Karabakh, Russian Defence  Ministry said on Tuesday. The exchange was facilitated by Russian peacekeepers that have been deployed in Nagorno-Karabakh under the deal. According to the ministry, 44 captives were handed over to Armenia and 12 to Azerbaijan.

column3: Execution of journalist was based on law: Iranian Prez Rouhani
column4: Iranian President Hassan Rouhani on Monday said that the execution of journalist Ruhollah Zam was based on law and that Iran's judiciary is independent. The comments come as many countries including France and the US condemned the execution of the journalist. Zam was executed on Saturday for his work online that helped inspire nationwide economic protests in 2017.

column3: Boko Haram claims kidnapping of hundreds of students in Nigeria
column4: Boko Haram has claimed responsibility for the abduction of over 300 students from an all-boys school in Nigeria's Katsina. "I am Abubakar Shekau...What happened in Katsina was done to promote Islam and discourage un-Islamic practices," the group's leader said in a voice message. Earlier, the army said it had located the hideout of the men and an operation was underway.

column3: S Korea bans sending of anti-N Korean leaflets across border
column4: South Korean Parliament has passed a bill criminalising sending of propaganda leaflets toward North Korea. Activist groups in South Korea have been using balloons to send anti-Pyongyang leaflets along with food, medicine, money and USB sticks containing news and dramas across the border for decades. Rights activists have condemned the legislation, calling it a move against freedom of speech.

column3: US sanctions Turkey over purchase of Russian S-400 missile system
column4: US has imposed sanctions on Turkey over its purchase of the Russian S-400 missile system last year, saying that the surface-to-air missile system is incompatible with NATO technology. We hope other countries take note of this action and "avoid further acquisitions of Russian equipment", US added. In 2018, India signed a $5.43 billion deal to procure five S-400 missile system.

column3: Blast on oil tanker caused by explosive-laden boat: Saudi Arabia
column4: The blast on an oil tanker at Saudi Arabia's Jeddah port on Monday was a terrorist attack, the kingdom's Energy Ministry said. The tanker was attacked by an explosive-laden boat, it added. "The incident did not result in any casualties, and there was no damage caused to the unloading facilities, nor any effect on supplies," the ministry further said.

column3: Hong Kong is becoming another Chinese-run communist city: US
column4: US State Secretary Mike Pompeo on Monday said that Hong Kong is becoming just another Chinese-run communist city and the Chinese Communist Party is not trustworthy. He added that US has also challenged the imprisonment of Hong Kong media tycoon Jimmy Lai under the new security law. Lai is a "true patriot" and cares about Hong Kong people, Pompeo said.

column3: BJP leaders sitting on strike broke CCTV cameras at Delhi CM's house: CMO
column4: BJP leaders sitting on strike in front of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's residence broke CCTV cameras installed at his house, CMO said on Sunday. This comes as Mayors of Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) and leaders continue their demonstration outside the CM's residence, demanding MCD's due of ₹13,000 crore from the Delhi government.

column3: 6 AAP MLAs including Raghav, Atishi detained outside Amit Shah & L-G's houses
column4: Delhi Police on Sunday detained six AAP MLAs, including Raghav Chadha and Atishi, as they allegedly tried to hold a protest near Home Minister Amit Shah and Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal's residences respectively. This comes a day after AAP alleged misappropriation of funds by BJP-ruled municipal corporations. The party has sought CBI probe into the matter.

column3: I'll observe 1-day fast in support of farmers, urge public to fast too: Delhi CM
column4: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said that he would be observing a one-day fast on Monday in support of the farmers protesting against the new farm laws. He also appealed to AAP workers and supporters and the public to observe the fast as well. Earlier, he had visited the Singhu Border to show his support to the farmers.

column3: BJP President JP Nadda tests positive for coronavirus, goes into home-isolation
column4: BJP National President JP Nadda on Sunday announced that he has tested positive for coronavirus. "My health is fine, and I'm following all the guidelines of home-isolation on the advice of doctors. Whoever has come in contact with me in the last few days, I request them to isolate themselves and get themselves checked," he tweeted.

column3: We will never forget cowardly attack on Parliament in 2001: PM Modi
column4: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said the country will never forget the "cowardly attack on our Parliament" in 2001 and paid tributes to security personnel who sacrificed their lives in the attack. The Parliament was adjourned at the time of the attack, but several parliamentarians and staff were present inside the building. All five terrorists were killed outside the building.

column3: EC seeks Kerala CM's explanation on free COVID-19 vaccine announcement
column4: Kerala State Election Commission has sought an explanation from Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan for allegedly violating the model code of conduct by saying that the COVID-19 vaccine would be made available free of cost in the state. Vijayan had made the announcement on Saturday shortly before campaigning for the third phase of local bodies polls came to a close.

column3: India being tested, will meet the challenge: EAM on China standoff
column4: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has said India was being tested in the seven-month-long border standoff with China in eastern Ladakh. He also added that he was confident that India would meet the national security challenge. He further added that what happened in eastern Ladakh was not actually in China's interest as it has significantly impacted public sentiment in India.

column3: Why new Parliament building when half of India hungry?: Haasan to PM Modi
column4: Actor-turned-politician Kamal Haasan on Sunday asked why a new Parliament building was being constructed at a cost of about ₹1,000 crore 'when half of India is starving due to loss of livelihood due to coronavirus'. To protect whom is the new Parliament building being constructed, Haasan asked, adding, "Please respond, my honourable elected Prime Minister."

column3: After attack on Nadda's convoy, Kailash Vijayvargiya gets bulletproof car
column4: BJP National General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya has been provided with a bulletproof vehicle by the Centre, days after he came under attack while travelling with party chief JP Nadda in West Bengal. In the December 10 attack, several vehicles in Nadda's cavalcade were damaged. Stones were pelted at the convoy at Diamond Harbour in South 24 Parganas district of Bengal.

column3: BJP may try to kill CM Mamata if it can't win against her: Bengal Minister
column4: West Bengal Minister and TMC leader Subrata Mukherjee said during a rally that if BJP fails to win the upcoming elections against CM Mamata Banerjee, it "may conspire to assassinate her by sending people secretly". Mukherjee had earlier blamed BJP workers for the attack on the saffron party's chief JP Nadda's convoy during his visit to the state.

column3: Detractors in Congress denied Sharad Pawar PM post twice: Praful Patel
column4: On two occasions NCP chief Sharad Pawar had opportunity to become PM but was denied the post by his detractors in Congress, said NCP's Praful Patel. "After Rajiv Gandhi's unfortunate death...There was a demand to make Pawar party president...but some drawing room politicians conspired to block this," said Patel. "They didn't want strong leadership for the party," he added.

column3: BJP wins 32 out of 49 seats in Goa Zilla Panchayat polls, Cong wins 4
column4: The ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) in Goa on Monday made big gains in the Zilla Panchayat elections, winning 32 out of 49 seats on offer. The Congress won four seats in the polls, while the NCP and the AAP bagged one seat each. The AAP has won its first-ever seat in an election in the coastal state.

column3: Assam cabinet clears proposal to shut govt-run madrassas, Sanskrit tols
column4: The Assam cabinet on Sunday approved the proposal to shut down all-government-run madrassas and Sanskrit tols (schools). The decision was taken during the cabinet meeting chaired by Assam Chief Minister Sarbananda Sonowal. The Bill regarding the proposal will be tabled in the upcoming winter session of the state Assembly, the state's Parliamentary Affairs Minister Chandra Mohan Patowary said.

column3: Shah said govt can't buy all crops at MSP: Bhartiya Kisan Union chief
column4: Bhartiya Kisan Union (Haryana) President Gurnam Singh Chaduni has said that the Centre was misleading on minimum support price (MSP). He added Home Minister Amit Shah said the government cannot buy all 23 crops at MSP as it would cost ₹17 lakh crore. Chaduni said that the Centre would continue to buy the crops at the same amount as before.

column3: Cong MLCs manhandle, remove K'taka Legislative Council Dy Chairman
column4: Congress MLCs on Tuesday manhandled and forcefully removed Deputy Chairman SL Dharmegowda from the chair in Karnataka Legislative Council. Congress MLC Prakash Rathod said BJP and JD(S) made him sit illegally when the House was not in order and therefore they evicted him. BJP MLC Lehar Singh Siroya said, "We've never seen such a shameful day in our Council's history."

column3: Congress wins 620 seats in municipal body polls in Rajasthan
column4: Congress won 620 seats in the polls for the 50 municipal bodies in Rajasthan. The State Election Commission on Sunday released the results of the general election. Out of 1,775 wards of all the bodies, 620 candidates of Congress, 548 of BJP, seven of BSP, two each of CPI and CPI (M), one of RLP and 595 Independent candidates won.

column3: AAP to contest UP elections in 2022: Arvind Kejriwal
column4: Aam Aadmi Party chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has said the party will contest the state elections in Uttar Pradesh in 2022. "A lot of people from UP who live in Delhi have told us that UP too deserves the welfare and benefits like Delhi," he added. He also said that all parties in UP have betrayed the people.

column3: Senior Raj leader Ghanshyam Tiwari returns to BJP 2 years after quitting
column4: Senior Rajasthan leader Ghanshyam Tiwari returned to BJP on Saturday, two years after he quit the party over differences with former CM Vasundhara Raje. Tiwari, who had floated his own outfit Bharat Vahini Party before 2018 Assembly elections, was seen sharing the stage at a rally with Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot and Congress leader Rahul Gandhi before 2019 general elections.

column3: Assam's BTC poll results show people's faith in PM's leadership: Nadda
column4: BJP President JP Nadda said that Assam's Bodoland Territorial Council (BTC) poll results show people's faith in leadership and policies of PM Narendra Modi. He also congratulated NDA partner UPPL, Assam CM Sarbananda Sonowal and other state BJP leaders for "securing clear majority". While BJP has won nine seats, UPPL has won 12 seats in the polls.

column3: Startup uses Tharoor's caricature in ad without consent; MP takes legal action
column4: Edtech startup Mastree used MP Shashi Tharoor's caricature without his consent for their advertisement with caption, "Gift your child Shashi Tharoor's confidence." Tharoor has sought a public apology and a legally binding commitment to 'cease and desist such practices'. "I was shocked...of their advertising using my name and caricature as if to imply I had endorsed their courses," Tharoor said.

column3: AAP to stage protest outside Delhi L-G, Amit Shah's homes tomorrow
column4: AAP leader Atishi Marlena on Saturday announced that councillors and MLAs of AAP will stage a sit-in in front of homes of Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal and Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday. She said that members will sit there till they get consent for CBI enquiry into the alleged misappropriation of ₹2,500 crore funds in North MCD.

column3: 100 BJP workers booked for organising 'welcome rally' in Gr Noida
column4: Police have registered a case against over 100 BJP workers for allegedly organising an unauthorised rally in Greater Noida on Sunday. Police said the "welcome rally" was allegedly for newly appointed party functionary Pandit Ashish Vats. "Vats, along with a group of BJP workers, reached the toll plaza in eight to 10 cars...[which] violated social distancing norms," the Sub-Inspector said.

column3: Pawar sought amendment to farm law for farmers' benefit: Sanjay Raut
column4: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Sunday defended NCP chief Sharad Pawar for urging states to amend the APMC Act when he was the Union Agriculture Minister. Raut, in Sena mouthpiece Saamana, wrote, "Ten years ago when Sharad Pawar sought reforms in the agricultural sector it was in the interest of the farmers. Then Ambani-Adani had not entered this field."

column3: BJP leaders' statements on farmers' protest condemnable: Gehlot
column4: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Monday said that BJP leaders' statements criticising farmers' protest are "most unfortunate and condemnable". "The government must find an amicable solution and address the grievances of farmers sympathetically instead of blaming gangs, anti-national elements for these protests," Gehlot said. "The farm laws...must be taken back," he added.

column3: Why should protests take place in America & London for farmers?: MoS
column4: Union Minister of State for Home Affairs G Kishan Reddy on Monday said that why should demonstrations take place in America, Canada and London in support of farmers' protests happening in India. He added, "Who is behind this? Some people want to carry out anti-India activities by misusing your (farmers') name. I request farmers to remain vigilant."

column3: VJ Chitra's husband didn't like scene she enacted, pushed her on day she died: Police
column4: Following the arrest of Tamil TV actress VJ Chitra's husband for allegedly abetting her suicide, Assistant Commissioner of Police Sudarshan told NDTV, "He didn't like a scene she had enacted on TV." "On the day she died, he had also pushed her," the official added. The 29-year-old actress was found dead at her hotel room in Chennai last week.

column3: Tamil TV actress Chitra's husband arrested for abetting her suicide
column4: Nearly a week after the Tamil TV actress Chitra was found dead in her hotel room, her husband Hemanth was arrested on Monday night for allegedly abetting her suicide. Chitra's mother had also accused Hemanth of harassing her daughter. Police said on the day of her suicide, Hemanth had an argument with her at a shooting spot near the hotel.

column3: Got only ₹20L of ₹35L fee for Aksar 2, have to pay mom's nurses ₹60k a month: Maker
column4: 'Aksar 2' director Ananth Narayan Mahadevan has alleged he hasn't been paid his full remuneration by the 2017 film's producer. "I was supposed to be paid ₹35 lakh. I've been paid ₹20 lakh till date over...two years," he stated. "My mother is...bedridden. I've to pay 2 nurses...₹60,000 a month...I've told the producers everything...But these people kept fooling me," said Ananth.

column3: Hrithik's 2016 FIR alleging imposter was talking to Kangana transferred to CIU
column4: Mumbai Police have transferred a 2016 FIR filed by actor Hrithik Roshan to Crime Branch CIU (Crime Intelligence Unit).  The FIR alleged that an unknown imposter was speaking to actress Kangana Ranaut on his behalf using an email ID. "So many years since our break up...he refuses to move on...@iHrithik kab tak royega ek chote se affair keliye?" Kangana reacted.

column3: Remo D'souza's wife shares video of the choreographer from hospital
column4: Lizelle D'souza, the wife of choreographer Remo D'souza, shared a video of her husband from a hospital, where he's recovering from heart attack he suffered on December 11. In the video, Remo can be seen tapping his feet while Imagine Dragons' Believer plays in the background. "Dancing with...feet is one thing dancing with the heart is another," Lizelle wrote.

column3: TV actor Aamir Ali shares Remo D'souza's pictures from hospital
column4: TV actor Aamir Ali took to Instagram to share choreographer-director Remo D'souza's pictures from hospital. Remo was hospitalised on Friday after he suffered a heart attack. "My brother is back @remodsouza #strongest," wrote Ali. Earlier, producer Ramesh Taurani had stated that a stent has been placed inside Remo's body and he is now stable.

column3: Arjun Rampal summoned again by NCB on Dec 16 in drug-related case
column4: Arjun Rampal has been summoned by NCB on December 16 for questioning in connection with a drug-related case. He was first summoned by the agency on  November 13 and was reportedly questioned for six hours. Last month, NCB had raided his residence and seized medicines which are controlled substances covered under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act.

column3: Kedarnath writer Kanika gets engaged to Raanjhanaa writer Himanshu, shares pics
column4: Kanika Dhillon, who wrote 'Kedarnath' screenplay, got engaged to National Award-winning screenwriter Himanshu Sharma, known for writing 'Raanjhanaa' and 'Tanu Weds Manu' screenplay. Sharing pictures, Kanika wrote, "#Famjam and more." Kanika was earlier married to director Prakash Kovelamudi and they announced their separation in 2019, while Himanshu was previously dating actress Swara Bhasker.

column3: Sushmita's daughter's Insta account hacked, actress says 'feel bad for idiot hacker'
column4: Actress Sushmita Sen revealed on Monday that her daughter Renee's Instagram account has been hacked. Calling the hacker "an idiot", Sushmita wrote on Instagram while sharing a screenshot of her daughter's profile, "[The hacker] doesn't realise yet, that Renee is happy to begin anew!!" "I feel bad for the guy!!" the actress added.

column3: Mohan Kapur to star in Marvel's 'Ms Marvel' web series
column4: Actor Mohan Kapur, who recently featured in 'Sadak 2', will star in Marvel's upcoming superhero web series 'Ms Marvel'. Reportedly, the six-episode series is currently being shot in Atlanta. Speaking about shooting amid COVID-19 pandemic, the actor said, "We have to undergo COVID-19 tests thrice a week till as long as we are shooting."

column3: Haven't watched many web shows, I prefer to watch news: Sidharth
column4: Actor Sidharth Shukla, who will make his digital platform debut with the upcoming third season of 'Broken But Beautiful' web series, revealed that he prefers watching the news over web-shows. Speaking about the first two seasons of the series, which starred Vikrant Massey, he told Mid-Day, "I haven't had the time to watch the show...I know that it was...successful."

column3: There's a lot more I can do: Anil on 40 yrs in film industry
column4: Actor Anil Kapoor, who started his acting career with the Telugu film 'Vamsa Vruksham' in 1980, spoke about completing 40 years in the film industry and mentioned that his talent hasn't fully been explored till now. "There's a lot more that I feel I can do...So I am always setting new boundaries and moving beyond them," he added.

column3: Remo is fine, will be back with me on trip to mountains soon: Raghav
column4: Giving a health update about choreographer-director Remo D'souza, who was hospitalised on Friday after he suffered a heart attack, dancer-actor Raghav Juyal took to Instagram and wrote, "Guys sir is fine now". He further wrote, "He is already recovering and will be back with me on a trip to the mountains soon. Just send him healing energies everyone."

column3: Rajinikanth resumes 'Annaatthe' shoot amid COVID-19, makers share pic
column4: Rajinikanth has resumed shooting for his upcoming movie 'Annaatthe' in Hyderabad and the makers of the film shared a photo of the actor and his daughter Aishwaryaa R Dhanush from the sets. The shooting was brought to a halt when the lockdown for COVID-19 was imposed. "Superstar Rajinikanth at Annaatthe shoot," production studio Sun Pictures tweeted with the picture.

column3: Gal is a great scene partner: Kristen on 'Wonder Woman 1984' co-star
column4: Hollywood actress Kristen Wiig, who will feature in 'Wonder Woman 1984' with Gal Gadot, commented on her experience of working with the Israeli actress and said, "We really hit it off." She further said, "We were making up songs and singing and laughing all the time. Gal is...a great scene partner and friend and I loved working with her."

column3: 'Tenet' has infused life back into me, can't wait to work more: Dimple
column4: In a recent interview, actress Dimple Kapadia said that starring in Christopher Nolan's 'Tenet' acted as an "adrenaline shot" for her and added, "This film has really infused life back into me." She mentioned that after working in 'Tenet', she is looking forward to what she can explore in the future. Nolan's film also stars Robert Pattinson and Elizabeth Debicki.

column3: Govt's plan is that all kinds of good films should be made: Javadekar
column4: I&B Minister Prakash Javadekar said government will promote all good films, including documentaries and short films, in India. "At IFFI, we'll showcase 21 non-feature films...At National Film Awards we've categories for short films...Mumbai International Film Festival also awards documentaries," he added. "This is government's plan...that all kinds of good films...are made," said Javadekar.

column3: Nothing short of a miracle: Shahid on wrapping up 'Jersey' amid COVID-19
column4: Shahid Kapoor on Monday marked the end of filming for his film 'Jersey' and praised the film's team for working during the coronavirus pandemic. He wrote on Instagram, "47 days of shoot during [COVID-19]...It's nothing short of a miracle. I want to thank each and everyone from the unit for coming to set every day, putting themselves at risk."

column3: Sanjay asked if I could bear trolls: Maheep on 'Fabulous Lives...'
column4: Sanjay Kapoor's wife Maheep Kapoor, who appeared in the web series 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives', said that before she joined the show, Sanjay asked her if she was "thick-skinned enough to bear being trolled". She told The Telegraph, "It...turned out to be a liberating experience...I don't...care about the negative people who are laughing and talking behind my back."

column3: She was a brilliant actor, so full of life: Hina on Divya's demise
column4: During a recent interview, actress Hina Khan mourned the demise of her 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai' co-star Divya Bhatnagar and said, "She was a brilliant actor, so full of life, so bubbly...and smiling all the time." She further said, "I was...depressed that day when I got to know that she didn't survive COVID-19...she was very young and very talented."

column3: Cinemas will be there but digital platforms have wide reach: Rajkummar
column4: Actor Rajkummar Rao, whose film 'Chhalaang' was recently released on a digital platform instead of movie theatres, said, "Cinemas will always be there but OTT also has a very wide reach." Commenting on the cinema vs OTT debate, the actor said, "OTT is definitely a very powerful platform...Cinema is a community viewing experience and OTT is a very personal experience."

column3: Can't mourn the way people want me to: Divya on being trolled after dad's death
column4: TV actress Divya Agarwal recently opened up about being trolled for sharing her magazine shoot pictures on Instagram days after the demise of her father. "Can't mourn the way people want me to, is there...rule book for it?" she said, adding, "I don't want to be constantly reminded...he's no more. [Don't] want validation from people that I'm grieving, it's personal."

column3: Vicky approached to play Big B's role in Chupke Chupke remake: Reports
column4: Actor Vicky Kaushal has reportedly been approached to play Amitabh Bachchan's role in the remake of 1975 film 'Chupke Chupke'. Reportedly, the film will also star Rajkummar Rao, who will essay the character played by Dharmendra in the original. The 1975 comedy-drama film, which was directed by Hrishikesh Mukherjee, also starred Sharmila Tagore and Jaya Bachchan, among others.

column3: Money only difference between Bengali & Hindi film industry: Jisshu
column4: Actor Jisshu Sengupta, who has starred in films like 'Durgamati: The Myth' and 'Sadak 2', talked about the difference between the Bengali and Hindi film industry and said, "The only difference between the two industries is money." He added, "It's the only thing because Bengal industry is smaller and Hindi has...international market. Other filming aspects of the entire production are...same."

column3: I have studied acting, I am an actor before anything else: Mallika
column4: Comedian Mallika Dua said it's a great time to be a performer with blurring boundaries between mediums like cinema, television and digital platforms and added, "I've studied acting and I'm...an actor before anything else." Dua, who starred in 'Indoo Ki Jawani', further said, "We're living in times when Bollywood stars are doing OTT shows and OTT actors are doing films."

column3: Own a car without buying it : Revv Subscriptions
column4: You can now drive a new car every month as Revv provides the option to subscribe to your favourite car for 1-36 months with ₹0 down payment, ₹0 road tax and without the hassle of maintenance and service. The car will be sanitized and delivered to your doorstep ensuring complete safety for you and your loved ones.

column3: Tesla's market value crosses $500 bn as shares surge six-fold this year
column4: Tesla Inc crossed $500 billion in market value on Tuesday as its share price surged six-fold this year. Tesla's shares rose as much as 3.9% to a record high of $542.35 in early trading. CEO Elon Musk has added $100.3 billion to his net worth so far this year, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

column3: Apple moves self-driving car unit under exec who oversees Siri: Report
column4: Apple has moved its self-driving car unit under the leadership of John Giannandrea, Senior Vice President of Machine Learning and AI Strategy, who also oversees the development of Apple's virtual assistant Siri, Bloomberg reported. Apple began working on its autonomous car project, known as Titan, in 2014. CEO Tim Cook in 2017 called autonomous systems "mother of all AI projects".

column3: Govt to set up 69,000 EV charging points across India: Gadkari
column4: Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari said the government is planning to set up at least one e-charging kiosk at around 69,000 petrol pumps across the country to induce people to go for electric vehicles (EVs). Gadkari had asked industry stakeholders to work towards making India an EV hub by 2025. GST on EVs has been reduced to 5%.

column3: US startup claims to have made 1st 'no charging' solar EV
column4: US-based Aptera Motors has introduced the "first solar electric vehicle" that requires "no charging" for most daily use and has a range of up to over 1,600 kilometres per full charge. Every Aptera is designed to harvest enough sunlight to travel over 17,702 kilometres per year in most regions. Liquid-cooled electric motors propel Aptera from 0-100 kilometres/hour in 3.5 seconds.

column3: US govt opens probe into 1.15L Tesla vehicles over suspension issue
column4: The US NHTSA opened an investigation into around 1.15 lakh Tesla vehicles over a front suspension safety issue. It said it was opening a preliminary evaluation into 2015-2017 Model S and 2016-2017 Model X vehicles after receiving 43 complaints alleging failure of the left or right front suspension fore links. "The complaints appear to indicate an increasing trend," NHTSA said.

column3: Tesla reveals women comprise 17% of its total US leadership roles
column4: Tesla revealed in its first-ever US diversity report that women comprise 17% of the company's leadership roles and 21% of the overall workforce. It added that Black people make up 4% of its US leadership roles and 10% of its total workforce. "While women are historically underrepresented...we recognise we have work to do in this area," Tesla said.

column3: Apple CFO, Apple's ex-design chief candidates for Ferrari CEO: Report
column4: Apple CFO Luca Maestri and former Chief Design Officer Jony Ive are reportedly candidates to be Ferrari's next CEO, Reuters reported. Ferrari CEO Louis Camilleri announced his retirement earlier due to "personal reasons". Former Vodafone CEO Vittorio Colao was allegedly in the running for the position too, but Reuters said a source close to Colao has called the claim "groundless".

column3: Tesla teams to visit Indonesia to discuss investment in EV components
column4: Tesla will send delegations to Indonesia next month to discuss potential investment in a supply chain for its electric vehicles. Government officials and Tesla CEO Elon Musk have discussed investment opportunities in Indonesia over a call. Indonesia earlier pointed out it has the "biggest" nickel reserves. Musk plans to offer a "giant contract for a long period of time".

column3: General Motors to not acquire 11% stake in Nikola
column4: General Motors (GM) and Nikola on Monday announced a reworked deal that replaced their previous agreement under which GM would acquire 11% equity stake in the startup and produce the proposed electric pickup Badger. The companies have instead signed a non-binding memorandum of understanding which is subject to negotiation. Nikola was previously accused of fraud by a short seller.

column3: Musk asks Tesla staff to push output to max possible through Dec: Report
column4: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has sent an email to workers encouraging them to push output to the maximum possible through December, Bloomberg reported. "We are fortunate to have the high-class problem of demand being quite a bit higher than production this quarter," the report quoted Musk. The company has a target of delivering 5 lakh cars this year.

column3: Baidu becomes 1st to get fully driverless road tests permit in Beijing
column4: Baidu has become the first to receive permits by the Beijing transportation authorities for five of its vehicles to conduct fully driverless road tests. It plans to remove safety drivers from test vehicles after gradually reducing human intervention. However, a remote safety operator will still be able to take control in an emergency via Baidu's 5G Remote Driving Service.

column3: Battery-operated bikes to be included in Delhi's EV policy: Report
column4: Delhi's EV policy is being revised to include a segment on battery-operated bicycles and tricycles, HT reported. The government has drafted a proposal to offer monetary incentives on their purchase. The proposed revision includes cycles both in the passenger and cargo categories. In case of individual buyers, purchase incentive will be 25% of the MRP with a cap of ₹5,000.

column3: Tesla asked to give ₹1 cr to used car buyer for hiding damage in China
column4: Tesla was ordered by a Chinese court to pay over ₹1 crore to the buyer of a used Model S car after concluding it concealed structural damage on the vehicle it sold on its official website. It was reportedly discovered part of the vehicle had been cut and welded back together. Tesla will appeal the ruling to a higher court.

column3: Amazon's Zoox unveils autonomous EV that can travel both ways
column4: Amazon-owned self-driving car platform Zoox has unveiled a fully autonomous electric vehicle with no steering wheel which can travel in either direction. Equipped with two battery packs, the four-seater robotaxi can run for 16 hours on a single charge and can attain a maximum speed of 120 kmph. CEO Aicha Evans said Zoox plans on launching an app-based ride-hailing service.

column3: Tesla to raise $5 billion as market cap crosses $600 billion
column4: Elon Musk-led Tesla on Tuesday announced that it will be raising $5 billion, marking its second capital raise in the last three months. The additional shares will be sold "from time to time" and "at-the-market" prices. Its shares are up nearly 670% this year with its market capitalisation crossing $600 billion. Tesla will join S&P 500 index later this month.

column3: Tesla to shut down production of Model S, X for 18 days: Report
column4: Elon Musk-led Tesla will shut down the production of its high-end Model S and Model X electric vehicles from December 24 to January 11 in Fremont, California, CNBC reported. Employees will be given a full week's pay along with few paid holidays. Deliveries of these models amounted to only 11% of total vehicle deliveries during Tesla's third quarter of 2020.

column3: Mahindra's Korean unit SsangYong defaults on $55 million loan
column4: Automaker Mahindra & Mahindra's South Korean unit SsangYong Motor Company has defaulted on loan repayment of about $55 million. Around $27.5 million was owed to Bank of America, $18.3 million to JP Morgan Chase and $9.1 million to BNP Paribas on December 14. Mahindra has been looking for a buyer for all or most of its 75% stake since June.

column3: Toyota halts operations at Karnataka plant as union strike continues
column4: Toyota Motor Corporation again halted operations at its car plant in Karnataka's Bidadi from Monday, as members of its workers' union continued a strike after the suspension of a worker wasn't withdrawn. Earlier, Toyota Kirloskar Motor (TKM) had declared a lockout at both its plants in Bidadi on November 10. The company said that the union had compromised COVID-19 guidelines.

column3: Delhi govt launches forum to discuss electric vehicle policy
column4: Delhi government on Friday launched the 'Delhi EV Forum', a common platform for multiple stakeholders to hold discussions on the government's electric vehicle (EV) policy. "Delhi EV Forum will be the first such forum in India...The first meeting will be held virtually on December 18," Delhi DDC Vice Chairperson said. The policy's objective is to combat air pollution in Delhi.

column3: Hyundai, Kia agree to $210M US penalty for delay in vehicles' recall
column4: Hyundai and Kia Motors have agreed to $140 million and $70 million civil penalties, respectively, after US auto safety regulators said they delayed recall of 1.6 million vehicles for engine issues. The settlement covers recall in 2015 and 2017 for manufacturing issues. Kia denied the allegations but agreed to settle the matter to "avoid a protracted dispute with the government".

column3: Tesla would consider buying a legacy automaker on friendly terms: Musk
column4: Tesla would consider leveraging the company's $554 billion market capitalisation to buy a legacy automaker, CEO Elon Musk said in an interview with Axel Springer. "We're definitely not going to launch a hostile takeover," Musk said. "If somebody said, 'Hey, we think it would be a good idea to merge with Tesla,' we certainly could have that conversation," he added.

column3: Workers of Toyota unit near B'luru to continue strike over workload
column4: Factory workers at Toyota Kirloskar Private Limited's Bidadi unit, located near Bengaluru, announced that they will continue their ongoing strike over increased workload, among other concerns. They said that they don't get time to drink water or use the washroom. The unit has been in a lockout since November 10, after 41 workers were suspended for allegedly questioning the management.

column3: Volkswagen CEO reveals they began 'Mission T' to catch up with Tesla
column4: Volkswagen CEO Herbert Diess, in a blog post, revealed he organised a three-day workshop nicknamed 'Mission T' to discuss how they could "catch up with Tesla". He added that they brought 31 senior executives from Volkswagen, Audi and Porsche together amid the COVID-19 pandemic to discuss how they could further their Project Artemis to take on Tesla.

column3: Five genes linked to most severe form of COVID-19 found
column4: Scientists in the UK have identified five genes that are linked with the most severe form of COVID-19. The genes partially explain why some people become extremely sick with COVID-19, while others are not affected, according to their study. "Our results immediately highlight which drugs should be at the top of the list for clinical testing," a scientist said.

column3: AstraZeneca to test combining Oxford vaccine with Sputnik V vaccine
column4: AstraZeneca, which is developing a coronavirus vaccine with Oxford University, said it would investigate combining its vaccine with Russia's Sputnik V vaccine. "Being able to combine different vaccines may be helpful to improve protection and/or to improve vaccine accessibility," AstraZeneca said. A 'mix and match' trial between AstraZeneca and Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccines was announced earlier.

column3: 4 volunteers who got Pfizer vaccine developed temporary facial paralysis: US FDA
column4: Four trial participants who received the Pfizer and BioNTech's coronavirus vaccine developed Bell's palsy, a form of temporary facial paralysis, according to the US' Food and Drug Administration (FDA). No members of the placebo group experienced similar adverse effects. There were no "meaningful imbalances" in serious health complications between the two groups, the FDA said in a report.

column3: India's 1st mRNA vaccine candidate gets DCGI nod for human trials
column4: India's first indigenous mRNA vaccine candidate has received approval to initiate Phase 1 and 2 human clinical trials from Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI). Pune-based Gennova Biopharmaceuticals developed the COVID-19 vaccine candidate, HGCO19, in collaboration with US-based HDT Bio. The vaccine demonstrated "safety and immunogenicity" in rodent and non-human primate models, Gennova said.

column3: Aus vaccine trial scrapped as participants returned false +ve HIV test results
column4: The University of Queensland and pharmaceutical company CSL have abandoned the clinical trial of their COVID-19 vaccine after several participants returned false positive HIV test results. CSL said the vaccine was safe and was proving effective, but that significant changes would be needed to HIV testing procedures in the healthcare setting to accommodate the rollout of the vaccine.

column3: Humanity will face 60°C temperatures in 2050s, warns WEF
column4: As many as two billion people will face 60°C temperatures for more than a tenth of the year in the 2050s, the World Economic Forum (WEF) warned citing a book. Up to 140 million people are expected to be displaced by 2050 because of food and water insecurity as well as extreme weather, it further said quoting the World Bank.

column3: NASA shares images of supermassive black holes merging
column4: NASA has shared images of two supermassive black holes in Galaxy NGC 6240 which are in the process of merging. "Seen as the bright dots near the center of this image, the black holes are just 3,000 light years apart," it said. "Eventually they will drift together, forming a larger black hole millions of years from now," NASA added.

column3: Human-made objects to outweigh living things by the end of 2020: Study
column4: Scientists have said that the weight of human-made objects will likely exceed that of living things by the end of the year. In a study published in the scientific journal Nature, scientists compared the overall living biomass on Earth, estimated to be around 1.1 teratonnes, to human-made mass. "We find that Earth is exactly at the crossover point," they said.

column3: Pics of 2020's last solar eclipse seen in parts of the world surface online
column4: Pictures of the last solar eclipse of 2020, witnessed on December 14, have surfaced online. The total solar eclipse was visible for people living in parts of Chile and Argentina. In some parts of South America, south-west Africa and Antarctica, people witnessed a partial solar eclipse. The total solar eclipse was not visible from India.

column3: Indian-American Raja Chari among 18 astronauts selected for next moon missions
column4: Indian-American astronaut Raja Chari is among the 18 astronauts selected to begin training for upcoming Artemis missions to the moon, NASA announced on Wednesday. The first woman and the next man on the moon will come from this group of 18 astronauts. "Proud to be part of the team working to take humans to the moon to stay," Chari tweeted.

column3: Videos of Geminids meteor shower surface online
column4: Videos of the Geminids meteor shower, recognised as the best annual meteor shower a stargazer can see, have surfaced online. According to NASA, the Geminids travel 78,000 mph (35 km/s). The parent of the Geminids is 3200 Phaethon, which is arguably considered to be either an asteroid or an extinct comet, NASA said.

column3: 7 of top 10 killers pre-COVID-19 were non-communicable diseases: WHO
column4: Non-communicable diseases accounted for seven of the top 10 causes of death before the coronavirus pandemic, the World Health Organization (WHO), citing data from 2000 to 2019, said. Heart disease has been world's biggest cause of death for the last 20 years, it added. In 2019, people were living for over six years longer than in 2000, it further said.

column3: Delhi startup builds tech to do COVID-19 serosurvey of 1 cr samples per week
column4: Delhi-based IT startup Thalamus Irwine claims to have developed an artificial intelligence and IoT-based solution that can complete a COVID-19 serosurvey of 1 crore samples in one week. It has also partnered with state-run ITI to host its data. Serosurveys can help track the geographic spread of the virus by analysing antibodies in blood samples.

column3: Researchers develop first AI tool to detect COVID-19 probability
column4: A team of researchers from the University of Vermont and Cedars-Sinai has developed the first software to predict the probability of COVID-19 infections. AI-COVID uses details from routine blood tests and can assign the probability of a patient being COVID-19 negative with high accuracy. This can help hospitals reduce the number of patients referred for PCR testing.

column3: Russian cosmonauts to receive Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine
column4: Russian space agency Roscosmos has said that Russian cosmonauts "will be among the first to be vaccinated" against COVID-19 with the Sputnik V vaccine but insisted that it will be done on a voluntary basis only. The vaccine will play an important role in ensuring the safety of Russia's space program, Minister of Health of the Russian Federation said.

column3: Scientists digitally rebuild dinosaur's brain, learn about its diet
column4: The University of Bristol's scientists have "rebuilt" the brain of a Thecodontosaurus, that roamed England some 205 million years ago, using advanced imaging and 3D modelling techniques. They said unlike its plant-eating relatives, Thecodontosaurus may have eaten meat and could have walked on two legs. Experts also reconstructed its inner ears and estimated that it had a high hearing frequency.

column3: India to soon be manufacturing hub of space assets: PM Modi to space industry
column4: Prime Minister Narendra Modi in his interaction with the space sector's key industries, startups and academia expressed that India will soon become a manufacturing hub of space assets. He also assured participants that they will be co-passengers with ISRO in this age of space research. He added that private investment in the sector will lead to creation of hi-tech jobs.

column3: New salamander species added to US' North Carolina's list of 63 species
column4: The US' North Carolina State added a new salamander species to its list of 63 species. The 'Carolina Sandhills Salamander' was previously categorised as an unusual population of the 'Southern Two-lined Salamander'. However, researchers used sequencing technology to show that the new species differs genetically. It also differs in colouration, size and natural history from complex's other members.

column3: Declare a State of Climate Emergency in your nations: UN to leaders
column4: World leaders should declare "States of Climate Emergency" in their countries until carbon neutrality is reached, UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said at a climate summit. "Can anybody still deny that we are facing a dramatic emergency?" he asked. He added G20 members are spending 50% more in their stimulus packages on fossil fuel-linked sectors and consumption, than on low-carbon energy.

column3: Superhighway system to travel via Solar System faster discovered: Scientists
column4: UC San Diego revealed researchers have discovered a new "superhighway" network to travel through the Solar System much faster. Such routes can drive comets and asteroids near Jupiter to Neptune in less than 10 years. Scientists found the routes by computing how "millions" of Solar System orbits fit within already-known space manifolds.

column3: Bacteria can travel between continents via dust, impact climate: Study
column4: A study by scientists, including those from the University of Granada, revealed bacteria can travel between continents "hidden" in atmospheric dust. These microbes may not only affect human and animal health but also impact climate and ecosystems. Their transport occurs via atmospheric particles called iberulites that humans can inhale. These aerosols act like a "launch vehicle" for bacteria.

column3: IUCN lists 31 species as 'Extinct', European Bison sees recovery
column4: The IUCN released an update of its Red List of Threatened Species which moved 31 species into the 'Extinct' category. However, the European Bison has moved from 'Vulnerable' to 'Near Threatened' category. Besides this, all of the world's freshwater dolphin species are now listed as threatened on the list. The lost shark has entered the 'Critically Endangered' (Possibly Extinct) category.

column3: Corals from Aus' 'Coral IVF' trial survive bleaching, on track to reproduce
column4: Coral populations from Australia's first "Coral IVF" trial on the Great Barrier Reef in 2016 have survived bleaching events and are on track to reproduce next year. Scientists said the larvae restoration technique worked just as they predicted and large corals can grow from tiny microscopic larvae within few years. The technique was first used just off Heron Island.

column3: India not historically responsible for climate change: Javadekar
column4: Environment Minister Prakash Javadekar has said India is not historically responsible for climate change but is taking steps to reduce emissions. He said India is the only G20 nation to be in compliance with the Paris Agreement. India has already achieved 21% of its target of reducing emissions intensity of GDP by 33%-35% by 2030, he added.

column3: SL records 2nd-highest human deaths due to conflict with elephant: Report
column4: Sri Lanka has recorded the second-highest human deaths due to the human-elephant conflict in the world after India, Daily News reported. Sri Lanka's COPA revealed the number of human deaths has increased from an average of 85 humans to 122 per year in the past 12 months in Sri Lanka. However, it has recorded the highest number of elephant deaths.

column3: Mi India to launch Mi QLED 4K TV in India on Dec 16
column4: Mi India has announced to launch Mi QLED 4K TV in India on December 16th. The TV will be equipped with premium features including Dolby Vision, Dolby Audio apart from the proprietary Vivid Picture Engine and PatchWall, it said. The company added that it plans to expand its lineup under the 'Make In India' initiative to nearly 100% in 2021.

column3: 7,000 people booked for violence at Karnataka's iPhone manufacturing plant
column4: A total of 7,000 people were booked, including 5,000 contract workers, in connection with the violence and vandalism at Wistron iPhone manufacturing plant in Karnataka's Kolar. Employees vandalised the plant due to non-payment of salaries. Wistron has clarified that the incident caused up to ₹52 crore in losses, a day after estimating damages worth ₹440 crore in a police complaint.

column3: Bugs in Cyberpunk 2077 game cost founders $1 billion of wealth
column4: The technical glitches in Cyberpunk 2077 game have cut more than $1 billion off the wealth of its Poland-based developer CD Projekt's founders. CD Projekt shares plunged by 32% over the past six days as the bugs prompted an apology from the company. The four founders' joint 34% stake was valued at about $3 billion on Tuesday.

column3: Mackenzie Scott gives away $4.1 billion in 4 months
column4: Novelist and philanthropist MacKenzie Scott, the ex-wife of Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos, has given away more than $4.1 billion in four months. The world's 18th-richest person, Scott said she asked her team to figure out how to give away her fortune faster. Her wealth has climbed $23.6 billion this year to $60.7 billion, according to Bloomberg.

column3: Indian-American Raja Chari selected by NASA to fly to ISS on SpaceX mission
column4: Indian-American astronaut Raja Chari has been selected by NASA alongside two other astronauts to fly to the International Space Station (ISS) on SpaceX Crew-3 mission in 2021. It'll be the first spaceflight for Chari and Matthias Maurer, and the third for NASA astronaut Tom Marshburn. Raja Chari is the only Indian-American among 18 astronauts selected for NASA's Moon mission.

column3: Not in India's DNA to be deterred by crisis, every crisis an opportunity: Ambani
column4: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani spoke to Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg about COVID-19's impact on India and said, "I think it's not in India’s DNA to be deterred by a crisis." Speaking at Facebook Fuel for India 2020 event, Ambani added, "Every crisis is an opportunity for new growth." Ambani also said, "India faced COVID-19 with enormous resilience and resolve."

column3: I've moved to Hawaii, will use Zoom to work from an island: Oracle Co-founder
column4: Oracle's billionaire Co-founder Larry Ellison informed his employees through an email that he is moving to Hawaii. "I'll be using the power of Zoom to work from the island of Lanai," he said in the email. Ellison reportedly paid $300 million for 90,000 acres on Lanai in 2012, and it is estimated that he owns 98% of the island.

column3: Only 42.6% of women in India have ever used internet: NFHS
column4: As per the fifth National Family Health Survey (NFHS) conducted in 22 states and UTs, only an average of 42.6% of women have ever used the internet in India as against an average of 62.16% among men. For the first time in 2019, the NFHS sought details on the percentage of men and women who have ever used the internet.

column3: Thiel-backed Bridgetown considers merger with Tokopedia: Report
column4: Peter Thiel-backed blank-check acquisition firm Bridgetown Holdings is considering a potential merger with Indonesia's PT Tokopedia, Bloomberg reported. SoftBank-backed Tokopedia could be valued between $8-$10 billion in a deal. Deliberations are at a preliminary stage and Bridgetown could still look at other potential targets. Bridgetown's shares soared 25% in premarket trading after the report.

column3: Having India-specific community guidelines is complex issue: Facebook
column4: Facebook's VP for Global Affairs and Communications Nick Clegg at an event said having India-specific community guidelines is a complex issue. He said Facebook has been put under "tremendous political pressure" in India and other places by people having different, and often conflicting views on online posts. Clegg said micromanaging every content online is not an effective approach of regulation.

column3: China's largest search engine Baidu considers making own EVs: Report
column4: China's largest search engine Baidu is considering making its own electric vehicles and has held talks with automakers about the possibility, Reuters reported. Baidu, which also has an autonomous driving unit, is considering contract manufacturing or creating a majority-owned venture with automakers. Baidu recently got the permit to conduct fully driverless road tests in Beijing.

column3: Snap, Pinterest form group to promote US internet law that protects them
column4: Several tech companies such as Snap, Pinterest and Reddit have announced a coalition called Internet Works which will work to promote Section 230 in US. The internet law under Communications Decency Act protects tech companies from liability over content posted by users. US President Donald Trump had earlier said he would veto $740-billion bill if it didn't eliminate Section 230.

column3: I don't consider it an apology: AI expert on Pichai's statement on her exit
column4: Former Google AI researcher Timnit Gebru in an interview with BBC said that she doesn't consider CEO Sundar Pichai's statement on her exit an apology. "He didn't even apologise for the company's handling of it," Gebru said. The researcher has alleged that she was fired from the company over an academic paper that she had co-authored.

column3: Gmail suffers outage for second time in 2 days
column4: Gmail suffered another outage affecting a "significant subset of users", one day after a range of Google services went down for close to an hour. "Affected users are able to access Gmail, but are seeing error messages, high latency, and/or other unexpected behavior," said Google. It later fixed the issue, hours after first problems were reported.

column3: Uber, Ola not acting as a cartel: Supreme Court
column4: The Supreme Court on Tuesday said Uber and Ola “do not facilitate cartelisation or anti-competitive practices between drivers” and that the drivers act as “independent individuals”. Advocate Samir Agarwal had challenged the cab aggregators, saying their price-fixing algorithm is not fair to drivers. The Competition Commission of India had also earlier dismissed Agarwal's plea.

column3: PUBG Mobile India may not launch until March 2021: Reports
column4: PUBG Mobile India will reportedly not be launching until March 2021, despite South Korea's PUBG Corporation announcing an India-specific game and local investments worth $100 million in November. PUBG had registered its subsidiary in Bengaluru last month. Reports of unsuccessful meetings between PUBG officials and the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) have also emerged.

column3: Pinterest settles gender discrimination suit with ex-COO for $22.5 mn
column4: Pinterest has settled the gender discrimination lawsuit filed by its former COO Francoise Brougher for $22.5 million. In August, Brougher had sued Pinterest, alleging gender discrimination, retaliation and wrongful termination. Pinterest and Brougher will donate about $2.5 million of the settlement to organisations that work to advance women and minorities in the technology industry.

column3: Facebook to move UK users to California terms in Brexit response
column4: Facebook will shift its United Kingdom users to user agreements with its corporate headquarters in California, moving them out of their current terms with Facebook's Irish unit and Europe's privacy laws. The change will take effect next year and follows a similar move by Google announced in February. "Facebook has had to make changes to respond to Brexit," it said.

column3: Australia sues Facebook for promoting VPN, collecting user data
column4: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) on Wednesday sued Facebook, accusing it of collecting user data without permission. The Australian regulator added that Facebook promoted a virtual private network (VPN) as a way for people to protect their data, while secretly using the information to pick targets for commercial acquisitions. Facebook shut its VPN product in 2019.

column3: Twitter to discontinue its streaming app Periscope by March 2021
column4: Twitter on Tuesday said it will shut down its live-streaming app Periscope, which it bought in 2015, due to declining usage over the last two years and high supporting costs. "Periscope app is in an unsustainable maintenance-mode state," it said. Twitter added that the announcement had to be delayed due to reprioritised projects amid COVID-19.

column3: Amazon accused of failing to comply with COVID-19 probe in US
